segment.source: Configure E-Mail Notification
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Notification

segment.source: Configure E-Mail Notification
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Notification

segment.source: Configure E-Mail Notification
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Notification

segment.source: When an Editor or a Reviewer attempts to create, deploy, or delete a Group Policy Object (GPO), a request for this action is sent to a designated e-mail address or addresses so that an Approver can evaluate the request and implement or deny it.
segment.target: When an Editor or a Reviewer attempts to create, deploy, or delete a Group Policy Object (GPO), a request for this action is sent to a designated e-mail address or addresses so that an Approver can evaluate the request and implement or deny it.

segment.source: You determine the e-mail address or addresses to which notifications are sent, as well as the alias from which notifications are sent.
segment.target: You determine the e-mail address or addresses to which notifications are sent, as well as the alias from which notifications are sent.

segment.source: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To configure e-mail notification for AGPM
segment.target: To configure e-mail notification for AGPM

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Domain Delegation tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Domain Delegation tab.

segment.source: In the From e-mail address field, type the e-mail alias for AGPM from which notifications should be sent.
segment.target: In the From e-mail address field, type the e-mail alias for AGPM from which notifications should be sent.

segment.source: In the To e-mail address field, type a comma-delimited list of e-mail addresses of Approvers who should receive requests for approval.
segment.target: In the To e-mail address field, type a comma-delimited list of e-mail addresses of Approvers who should receive requests for approval.

segment.source: In the SMTP server field, type a valid SMTP mail server.
segment.target: In the SMTP server field, type a valid SMTP mail server.

segment.source: In the User name and Password fields, type the credentials of a user with access to the SMTP service.
segment.target: In the User name and Password fields, type the credentials of a user with access to the SMTP service.

segment.source: Click Apply.
segment.target: Click Apply.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Modify Options permissions for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Modify Options permissions for the domain.

segment.source: E-mail notification for AGPM is a domain-level setting.
segment.target: E-mail notification for AGPM is a domain-level setting.

segment.source: You can provide different Approver e-mail addresses or AGPM e-mail aliases on each domain's Domain Delegation tab, or use the same e-mail addresses throughout your environment.
segment.target: You can provide different Approver e-mail addresses or AGPM e-mail aliases on each domain's Domain Delegation tab, or use the same e-mail addresses throughout your environment.

segment.source: By default, e-mail messages sent as a result of actions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) are not encrypted.
segment.target: By default, e-mail messages sent as a result of actions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) are not encrypted.

segment.source: However, you can configure e-mail security for AGPM using registry settings to specify whether to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption and which SMTP port to use.
segment.target: However, you can configure e-mail security for AGPM using registry settings to specify whether to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption and which SMTP port to use.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM.

segment.target: Additional references
